reasoning: Diabetic retinopathy is a chronic complication of diabetes affecting approximately 30-40% of people with diabetes globally. Reported as prevalence rather than incidence since it's a chronic condition with gradual onset. Global prevalence estimated at ~2800 per 100k general population based on diabetes prevalence (8-9% globally) and DR prevalence among diabetics (30-40%).
source: Fong DS et al. (2004). The relative roles of nonproliferative and proliferative retinopathy in the development of macular edema and retinal detachment in Type 2 diabetes. Ophthalmology. 111(12):2241-2245; WHO Global Burden of Disease Study 2005
